DataElement.preferredName: LASA Past Week Spiritual Well-being Rating Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's rating of their spiritual well being during the past week, using an eleven point Linear Analogue Self-Assessment scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Linear Analogue Self-Assessment Past Week Spiritual Well-being Rating Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy._The most recent week, including today._A question regarding the status of one's sense of meaning and purpose in life and ability to relate to their religious beliefs._The act of ascertaining or fixing the value or worth of something._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy.

Concepts.definition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Spiritual Well-being Rating Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question regarding the status of one's sense of meaning and purpose in life and ability to relate to their religious beliefs.:The act of ascertaining or fixing the value or worth of something.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question regarding the status of one's sense of meaning and purpose in life and ability to relate to their religious beliefs.
The act of ascertaining or fixing the value or worth of something.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: LASA:Single-Item Linear Analog Scale Assessment of Quality of Life. Dona E.C. Locke, PhD, et.al. J Pain Symptom Manage. 2007 December ; 34(6): 628-638.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR study in C3D. mc 7/1/2016

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective rating score of 0 on a linear analogue scale with anchor point descriptions of 0: As bad as it can be and 10: As good as it can be.

Concepts.definition: A subjective rating score of 0 on a linear analogue scale with anchor point descriptions of 0: As bad as it can be and 10: As good as it can be.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How would you rate your spiri
ReferenceDocuments.description: How would you rate your spiritual well being over the past week? This question refers to such things as a sense of meaning and purpose, relationship with God, etc.
